result.execSummary:
The defendant Jasmin D Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered all costs and surcharges to be paid by July 1, 2015, alternative is a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence.  To commence forthwith.  Huber privleegs for work, school and childcare.   Court recommends against electronic monitoring.

Provide a  DNA sample.
Court ordered defendant not vote until her civil rights are restored.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess firearms.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 0 days served; Huber privileges for work, school and child care. Court recommends against electronic monitoring. Sentence to commence forthwith.
.
Court ordered all costs and surcharges be paid by July 1, 2016, alternative is a civil judgment.
.
Court ordered defendant not vote until her civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may not possess firearms.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed.

Defendant Jasmin D Smith in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Jasmin D Smith in custody.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy clerk:  dn
.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.

At the parties request, case is calendared for a plea and sentencing hearing on 05/08/2015 at 01:30 p.m. in Room 500 of the Courthouse, Judge Sankovitz presiding.
cab

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Jasmin D Smith not in court, in custody.  Michaeld Lonski for Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea/sentencing.  Defense not prepared to proceed on today.  Request for adjournment heard and granted; date selected with defense.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring. DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant Jasmin D Smith in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Jasmin D Smith in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Moroney.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Brash, Br. 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 21.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
